text:
I write a weekly newsletter focused on SaaS content marketing. 

<https://yourcontentmart.co/saas-growth-bites/|https://yourcontentmart.co/saas-growth-bites/>

attachments.fallback: Your Content Mart: SaaS Growth Bites | A Weekly Newsletter For SaaS Founders & Marketers
attachments.text: SaaS Growth Bites is a weekly newsletter that provides you with up-to-date actionable content marketing tips and strategies for growing your SaaS business.
attachments.title: SaaS Growth Bites | A Weekly Newsletter For SaaS Founders & Marketers

elements.text: I write a weekly newsletter focused on SaaS content marketing.

text:
Lesson: Let them know what tribe you roll with...

As a saas partnership prosector / partnership marketing director my job becomes massively easier when I "know the secret handshake".

For instance, I had a call today with a potential partner. Not to give it away, but they are a "hot sauce" theme calendar app. Our SMS app with their's is a solid co-promoted use case webinar.

However because they didn't know "we roll with Aircall and HubSpot", they came to the meeting somewhat skeptical and dismissive we are a "player" they want to roll with.

Now here's the magic.

I happened to have a call today with my partnership peeps at Aircall. They mentioned they have a call with the VERY SAME calendar app team I talked to today.

SPOOKY GOOD!

So I asked my Aircall peeps if we could take a photo to celebrate where we are and where we are going, and if it would be okay to share this photo with the potential calendar app partner I talked to earlier.

They said, "no problem".

And I emailed this photo and a message saying something like "Hey, met with the Aircall team today to talk about 2022 and how all three of our companies could do great things together working together. Cheers -JZ".

My takeaway. Know who your prospects already know, like and trust. Go on LinkedIN or to their website to see who's already in their tribe!

PS: I could see this working well for getting SEO/backlink partnerships too. Which is part of our overall partnership strategy.

Then whenever possible preposition yourself before a call with social proof (like this photo). I imagine my next partnership call with the "Hot Sauce Themed" calendar app will be much... ahem, "hotter".
